CodeList.Name: Cardiac Procedure Indication

Description.TranslatedText: The reason that a subject had a cardiac procedure.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: The intended recipient of a heart transplant.
An episode of cardiac arrest or arrhythmia where the etiology was unknown.

A disease of the heart muscle or myocardium proper. Cardiomyopathies may be classified as either primary or secondary, on the basis of etiology, or on the pathophysiology of the lesion: hypertrophic, dilated, or restrictive.
A longstanding, complete blockage of a vessel.
The subject contributing a heart for a cardiac transplant.
The battery that supplies the device has reached the end of its life.
There is a faulty connector/header in the device.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: GENERATOR IS BEING REPLACED AT THE TIME OF LEAD REVISION
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A cardiac lead requires revision, at which time the generator to the device will be replaced.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Cardiac Device Generator is Being Replaced at Time of Lead Revision

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: The device has a generator malfunction.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: IMMEDIATE PERCUTANEOUS CORONARY INTERVENTION (PCI) FOR ST ELEVATION MYOCARDIAL INFARCTION (STEMI)
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: An immediate percutaneous coronary intervention is necessary for a myocardial infarction that presents with ST segment elevation.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Immediate Percutaneous Coronary Intervention for ST Elevation Myocardial Infarction

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact. (NCI)
A cardiac lead has damaged local tissue enough to require treatment.
The degree of impairment of the left cardiac ventricle to contract efficiently.
An imperative issued by the manufacturer of a device that the device needs to be returned to a designated source for repair or replacement.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: MANUFACTURER RECOGNIZED A RECURRING PERFORMANCE FAILURE
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: The device manufacturer had recognized a recurrent performance failure in the device.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Manufacturer Recognized a Recurring Performance Failure

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: MEDICAL CONDITION OR PROCEDURE AFFECTS IMPLANTATION SITE
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: The medical condition or the procedure affects the device implantation site.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Medical Condition or Procedure Affects Implantation Site

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: MEDICAL OR SURGICAL PROCEDURE REQUIRING RELOCATION OF LEAD
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: An intended medical or surgical procedure necessitates the relocation of a cardiac lead.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Medical or Surgical Procedure Requiring Relocation of Lead

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: PERCUTANEOUS CORONARY INTERVENTION (PCI) FOR HIGH RISK NON-ST ELEVATION MYOCARDIAL INFARCTION OR UNSTABLE ANGINA
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Includes patients with unstable angina or Non-STEMI who have high risk features for short-term risk of death or nonfatal MI. High risk features includes at least one of the following: history of accelerating tempo of ischemic symptoms in preceding 48 hours; character of pain - prolonged ongoing (greater than 20 minutes) rest pain; clinical findings - pulmonary edema, most likely due to ischemia or new or worsening mitral regurgitation murmur; or S3 or new worsening rales or Hypotension, bradycardia, tachycardia or age greater than 75 years; ECG - angina at rest with transient ST-segment changes greater than 0.5 mm or bundle-branch block, new or presumed new or sustained ventricular tachycardia; cardiac markers - NSTEMI patients with elevated cardiac TnT, Tnl, or CK-MB.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Percutaneous Coronary Intervention for High Risk Non-ST Elevation Myocardial Infarction or Unstable Angina

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: PERCUTANEOUS CORONARY INTERVENTION (PCI) FOR ST ELEVATION MYOCARDIAL INFARCTION (STEMI) (STABLE AFTER SUCCESSFUL FULL-DOSE THROMBOLYTICS)
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A percutaneous coronary intervention is necessary for a myocardial infarction that presents with ST segment elevation and the subject does not have recurrent or persistent symptoms, symptoms of heart failure or ventricular arrhythmia after a successful dose of thrombolytic therapy.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Percutaneous Coronary Intervention for ST Elevation Myocardial Infarction-Stable After Successful Full-Dose Thrombolytic Therapy

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: PERCUTANEOUS CORONARY INTERVENTION (PCI) FOR ST ELEVATION MYOCARDIAL INFARCTION (STEMI) (STABLE, >12 HRS FROM SYMPTOM ONSET)
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A percutaneous coronary intervention is necessary for a myocardial infarction that presents with ST segment elevation and the subject does not have recurrent or persistent symptoms, symptoms of heart failure or ventricular arrhythmia. The presentation is past twelve hours since onset of symptoms.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Percutaneous Coronary Intervention for ST Elevation Myocardial Infarction-Stable-Over 12 Hours From Symptom Onset

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: PERCUTANEOUS CORONARY INTERVENTION (PCI) FOR ST ELEVATION MYOCARDIAL INFARCTION (STEMI) (UNSTABLE, >12 HRS FROM SYMPTOM ONSET)
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A percutaneous coronary intervention is necessary for a myocardial infarction that presents with ST segment elevation and the subject has recurrent or persistent symptoms, symptoms of heart failure or ventricular arrhythmia. The presentation is past twelve hours since onset of symptoms.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Percutaneous Coronary Intervention for ST Elevation Myocardial Infarction-Unstable-Over 12 Hours From Symptom Onset

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A procedure to evaluate the health of the an individual after receiving a heart transplant.
A procedure to evaluate the health of the cardiac system to determine feasibility of a non-cardiac related surgical procedure.
A procedure performed to avoid the first occurrence of a disease condition.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: RESCUE PERCUTANEOUS CORONARY INTERVENTION (PCI) FOR ST ELEVATION MYOCARDIAL INFARCTION (STEMI) (AFTER FAILED FULL-DOSE THROMBOLYTICS)
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A percutaneous coronary intervention is imperative for a myocardial infarction that presents with ST segment elevation after an unsatisfactory response to a full dose of thrombolytic therapy.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Rescue Percutaneous Coronary Intervention for ST Elevation Myocardial Infarction After Failed Full-Dose Thrombolytic Therapy

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A procedure performed to avoid a subsequent occurrence of a disease condition.
Ventricular tachycardia that occurs without provocation and does not resolve spontaneously.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Spontaneous Sustained Ventricular Tachycardia by ECG Finding

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A subsequent Percutaneous Coronary Intervention in a planned series of procedures, where the first PCI could have been during a prior admission, or during this admission.

A sudden loss of consciousness with loss of postural tone not related to anesthesia with high risk characteristics. High risk characteristics include non-ischemic dilated cardiomyopathy, or ischemic heart disease with significant ventricular dysfunction, hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, Brugada Syndrome, or Long QT Syndrome.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Syncope with High Risk Cardiac Characteristics

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Sudden loss of consciousness with loss of postural tone not related to anesthesia with ventricular tachycardia (VT) that can be induced during an electrophysiological study.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Syncope with Inducible Ventricular Tachycardia by ECG Finding

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused. (NCI)

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: UPGRADE TO A DEVICE WITH ADDITIONAL PACING CAPABILITIES
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A device with additional pacing capabilities is replacing the current device.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Upgrade to Cardiac Device with Additional Pacing Capabilities

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Ventricular Fibrillation is characterized by rapid, usually more than 300 bpm (cycle length: 180 ms or less), grossly irregular ventricular rhythm with marked variability in QRS cycle length, morphology, and amplitude.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Cardiac Procedure Indication Terminology
